#summary The tomcat-check project overview

=Overview=

*tomcat-check* perl daemon-script checks periodically [http://tomcat.apache.org/ Apache Tomcat] processes status, performs some comparisons and then triggers some alarms (syslog and mail messages to sysadmins).

The processes status of Apache Tomcat are checked using the builtin Apache Tomcat HTTP monitoring interface called [http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-6.0-doc/manager-howto.html Manager].

Usually this interface output HTML but with the undocumented [http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/tc6.0.x/trunk/java/org/apache/catalina/manager/StatusManagerServlet.java but active in the code of StatusManagerServlet.java] functionality to output _well formed XML_ with the manager status data, *tomcat-check* parses this _XML_ to do its job. 

*tomcat-check* can be _complemented_ with the google code project *[http://code.google.com/p/psi-probe/ psi-probe]* an enhanced replacement for Apache Tomcat Manager.
